title: Area Volume with pond part - b

content.description: Let R be the region bounded by the graphs of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mi>sin</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>π</mi> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41EB@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F99@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, as shown in the figure above.
content.question: The horizontal line y = -2 splits the region R into two parts. Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression for the area of the part of R that is below this horizontal line.

frqParts.text: The horizontal line y = -2 splits the region R into two parts. Write, but do not evaluate, an integral expression for the area of the part of R that is below this horizontal line.

topic.text: 8.4: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of x

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
